title: How to Make Sweet Onion Sauce

steps.headline: Squeeze the onion for juice.
steps.description: Take a small slice of onion and place it in a garlic press. Squeeze the press to extract juice from the onion. You'll need about 3/4 of a teaspoon (4 ml) of juice and pour the juice into a small saucepan.

steps.headline: Measure all of the ingredients into a saucepan.
steps.description:
Measure 1 cup and 2 tablespoons (225 g) of granulated sugar, 1⁄2 cup and 1 tablespoon (255 ml) of cold water, 6 tablespoons (89 ml) of white vinegar, and 1 1⁄2 tablespoons (22 ml) of red wine vinegar into a small saucepan. You'll also need to add these seasonings:
1 tablespoon (8 g) arrowroot
1 tablespoon (5 g) minced onion flakes
2 1⁄2 teaspoons (13 g) Dijon mustard
2 1⁄2 teaspoons (5 g) mustard powder
3⁄4 teaspoon (3 g) celery salt
3⁄4 teaspoon (9 g) poppy seeds
1⁄2 teaspoon (2 g) onion salt
1⁄4 teaspoon (1 g) garlic salt
1⁄4 teaspoon (0.5 g) paprika
1⁄4 teaspoon (0.5 g) black pepper
1 to 2 drops sesame oil

steps.headline: Whisk and heat the sauce.
steps.description: Set the saucepan on the stove and turn the heat to high. Whisk the sauce while it heats and bring it to a boil.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat and simmer the sauce for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Once the sauce comes to a boil, turn the heat to low. Keep whisking the sauce and let it simmer until it thickens. This should take about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Cool and use the sauce.
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the sweet onion sauce come to room temperature. Use the sauce immediately or store it until you're ready to use it. Transfer the sauce to an airtight container and keep it in the fridge for a few weeks.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and prepare the garlic.
steps.description: Turn on the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Get out a rimmed baking sheet and a piece of foil. Place 6 unpeeled garlic cloves in the center of the foil and wrap the foil tightly around them. Put the wrapped foil on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Peel, slice, and season the onions.
steps.description: Peel two large Vidalia (sweet) onions. Use a sharp knife to carefully cut each onion into four large pieces. Set the quarters on the baking sheet with the garlic packet and brush the onions with a little vegetable oil.

steps.headline: Roast the onions with the garlic for one hour.
steps.description: Put the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake the onions with the garlic for another hour. The onions should become slightly charred and completely soft. Then, carefully open the aluminium foil to see if the garlic is soft. Let the onions and garlic cool completely.

steps.headline: Peel the garlic and put the sauce ingredients into a blender.
steps.description:
Peel the cloves of garlic and scoop the softened cloves into a blender or food processor. Add the roasted onions along with:
1/2 cup (120 ml) apple cider vinegar
1/4 cup (60 ml) fresh lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste

steps.headline: Blend the sauce and incorporate the oil.
steps.description: Put the lid on the blender and puree the ingredients until they're completely smooth. Keep the blender running and open the pouring spout on the top of the machine. Slowly pour in 1 1/4 cups (295 ml) of vegetable oil until it's combined. You can use the sauce immediately. If you'd like to store leftover sauce, transfer it to an airtight container and keep it in the refrigerator for up to four days.

steps.headline: Chop the sweet onion and garlic.
steps.description: Roughly chop enough sweet onion to measure 1/8 to 1/4 cup (20 to 40 g). You'll also need to chop 1 clove of garlic. Transfer the onion and garlic to a food processor or blender.

steps.headline: Measure and add the remaining ingredients.
steps.description:
Use measuring spoons or a digital scale to measure the rest of the sauce ingredients and add them to the blender. You'll need:
2 tablespoons (30 g) mayonnaise
3 tablespoons (45 ml) vegetable oil
2 tablespoons (30) cream or half-and-half
2 tablespoons (30 ml) apple cider vinegar
1 tablespoon (15 ml) water
1/2 teaspoon (2 g) salt

steps.headline: Blend the sauce until it's smooth.
steps.description: Put the lid on the blender and blend the ingredients until the sauce becomes completely smooth and creamy. Finally, give the sauce a taste test and add extra salt or pepper if desired. You can refrigerate the leftover sauce in an airtight container for a few days. Just remember to stir it again before serving it to regain the texture after it is refrigerated.
